AAW.caption: Text
AAW.doc: Insert some text in the document. Pro bubbler tip: This is super useful to insert images through BBCode and to achieve rich styling of texts, and also to use with infinitely nested data by using ":format as text" operator on lists, check that operator out, there are videos, forum posts and more about it. Also, by infinitely nested I mean that you can use the operator again if you have a list as a field inside your initial list, as in list of stores, and each store has a list of products.
AAW.name: inputtedText

ABC.caption: Below you will be able to set extra margins for your text element. Leave the box unchecked for a default display. (Will ignore any numbers below)
ABC.name: margin_info

AEP.caption: Page break
AEP.doc: Choose if this element will try to enforce a new page before or after itself.
AEP.name: page_break

AEa.caption: Is this element being put into a Multi Column?
AEa.doc: Mark this box if this element is between the Start and End of a multi column element.
AEa.name: into_multi_column

AEb.caption: This Column's Width
AEb.doc: Fit content will make the column have the width of their content. Fit available space will extend the column's width to all horizontal avaliable space in the page. Fixed width will need you to specify a width number in the field below.
AEb.name: this_column_width

AEc.caption: Multi Column Name
AEc.doc: The name of the multi column you're wrapping this element within.
AEc.name: multi_column_name

AFS.caption: Is this element being put into the footer?
AFS.doc: Mark this box if this element is to be inserted into the footer.
AFS.name: into_footer

AFZ.caption: Is this element being put into the header?
AFZ.doc: Mark this box if this element is to be inserted into the header.
AFZ.name: into_header

AFr.caption: Is this element being put into the background?
AFr.doc: Mark this box if this element is to be inserted into the background.
AFr.name: into_background

AGF.caption: Repeating structure auxiliary fields. Only use the fields below if this element is being inserted into a repeating structure
AGF.name: repeating_structure_auxiliary_fields

AGG.caption: Structure name
AGG.doc: The unique name of the repeating structure this text is being inserted into.
AGG.name: repeating_structure_name

AGH.caption: Text list
AGH.doc: Optional. If you fill this field, the field "Text" up there will be ignored. With this field you can pass a list to be displayed, for example the first item of the list will appear in the first structure. Leave this one blank and the text up there will be used and every repeated text will be the same, this is ideal for texts that won't change for example labels ("Name", "Phone", etc) and sometimes titles.
AGH.name: text_list

AHw.caption: Parse BBcode
AHw.doc: If "Yes", it will interpret [b]hello[/b] as a bold hello. Search the web to understand what BBCode is. Official is: https://www.bbcode.org/ To help, BBCode is what is outputted by rich text editors.  All standard BBCode tags are supported, except for the video tag. At the site above you will be able to see what are the standard tags.  The style defined in BBCode will override the style defined in the "Define new style for" action.  Non-standard tags that are outputted by Bubble's rich text editors are supported as well. The legacy rich text editor from Bubble will work fine. A new one from Bubble uses a different line break scheme, this means line breaks will sometimes disappear, in other words, some "new line"s will be "skipped" or "eaten". Also, this may be fixed eventually by external forces, but parsing BBCode will throw an error in Apple devices for client side workflow actions due to something that is Apple's fault, so for it to work in Apple devices you must not parse BBCode, an alternative is for you to use the server side (backend) version of the workflow actions. You can differentiate them because client side uses "PDF Model X" in the name, while backend version will not have that suffix. Also, client and server side workflow action versions do not mix.
AHw.name: parse_bbcode

AOw.caption: Fixed width size
AOw.doc: If you select "Fixed width" in the dropdown above then you must specify a number here. Play with numbers to check the size, but know that the size here is in "points" not "pixels". You can search the web to know more about that unit of measure.
AOw.name: fixed_width_column_size
